section.title: Apple certificate managementEO_apns_certificate
section.para: Apple requires the use of an Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate to manage iOS and Mac OS X devices. The APNs certificate must be renewed yearly.

itemizedlist.title: To avoid issues in the future, follow these best practices:

listitem.para: See Consequences of letting a certificate expire
Create an Apple ID that is used only for APNs certificate management.

section.bridgehead: Consequences of letting a certificate expire
section.para: If the certificate expires, devices continue to operate normally, but they no longer trust APNs commands. Symantec Security Cloud cannot monitor compliance settings, send commands, or change configuration settings. All of your iOS devices are effectively unmanaged.

warning.label: Warning:
warning.para: An expired certificate cannot be renewed. Instead, you must create a new certificate and your users must re-enroll all of their Apple devices.

section.para: Before the APNs certificate expires, Symantec Security Cloud alerts you to help ensure that the certificate is renewed successfully.
An Apple ID is required to create or renew a certificate. The same Apple ID that you use to create a certificate must be used to renew the certificate.

itemizedlist.title: Create an Apple ID that meets these criteria:

listitem.para: The ID is used only for APNs certificate management.
The ID is associated with a team or task email account or mailbox at your organization.
Do not use a personal Apple ID or an Apple ID that is associated with an individual employee email account.

note.para: Be sure to document all necessary information about the Apple ID and the associated account or mailbox, including ownership and access credentials.
